concise_definition: n. 残骸, 毁灭; v. 毁坏, 破坏

definitions.explanation_en: The remains of something that has been severely damaged or destroyed, especially a vehicle, ship, or aircraft after an accident.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指严重损坏或毁灭后的残骸，尤指交通事故后的车辆、船只或飞机残体。
definitions.example_en: The divers explored the wreck of the Titanic, which lies at the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean.
definitions.example_cn: 潜水员探索了沉没在大西洋底部的泰坦尼克号残骸。

definitions.explanation_en: A person or thing that has been ruined or broken down, often physically or emotionally; a state of severe deterioration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指身体或情感上被彻底摧毁的人或事物；一种严重衰败的状态。
definitions.example_en: After the divorce, he was a wreck—unable to sleep or eat properly.
definitions.example_cn: 离婚后，他形同废人，无法正常睡眠或进食。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause severe damage or destruction to something, often suddenly or violently.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指突然或猛烈地对某物造成严重破坏或毁灭。
definitions.example_en: The storm wrecked the coastal villages, leaving thousands homeless.
definitions.example_cn: 风暴摧毁了沿海村庄，使数千人无家可归。

definitions.explanation_en: To ruin or destroy someone’s health, emotions, or mental state through prolonged stress or hardship.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过长期的压力或苦难摧毁某人的健康、情绪或精神状态。
definitions.example_en: Years of overwork have wrecked her health.
definitions.example_cn: 多年的过度劳累已经毁掉了她的健康。

comparison.analysis: “Ruins” (废墟) 通常指建筑或结构因时间、战争或灾难而长期崩塌后的状态，强调静态的、遗留的残迹，常用于历史或考古语境。而 “wreck” 更强调破坏的瞬间性或剧烈性，且可指人或抽象事物的崩溃。
“Destroy” (摧毁) 是一个更广泛、更中性的动词，指彻底消除某物的存在或功能，不强调残骸的遗留。而 “wreck” 常暗示破坏后仍留下可见的残骸，且多用于交通工具、建筑或身体/心理状态的崩溃。
“Demolish” (拆除) 通常指有计划、有目的的拆毁，尤其用于建筑物，带有工程性或官方行为的意味。而 “wreck” 更偏向意外、暴力或非计划性的破坏，情感色彩更强，常含惋惜或震惊。
